intro: Rhytiglossa distorta, commonly known as the distorted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
